title: How GoTenderly Works   Complete Guide
description: A practical, step-by-step guide that explains how GoTenderly (Qatar Tender Platform) works for procuring teams and suppliers   from publishing a tender to awarding the contract.
content:
Overview

GoTenderly is a purpose-built tendering platform for Qatar projects that streamlines every stage of procurement: publishing opportunities, managing clarifications, accepting structured submissions, evaluating bids, and awarding contracts all with a clear audit trail. This article explains exactly how the platform works for both procuring teams and suppliers, with practical steps, templates, and platform tips you can use today.

How GoTenderly Works Step by Step

  1. Account setup (Buyers and Suppliers)

    Create an account (organization or individual). Buyers complete organization profile, procurement contact, and approval workflow. Suppliers complete company profile, attach trade license, classification, and bank/finance summary for pre-qualification.

  2. Create & publish a tender

    Buyers fill a guided tender form: title, reference, SoW, BoQ upload, mandatory documents, submission deadline, and evaluation criteria. Optionally add tags (construction, IT, FM, qatar) and attach Annex templates. Use the built-in editor or upload your existing tender document GoTenderly automatically extracts key dates and fields for indexing.

  3. Pre-qualification & shortlist (optional)

    If required, enable a PQ stage. Suppliers submit qualification packs (certificates, financials). The buyer reviews and shortlists directly on the platform, with auto-generated PQ reports for auditors.

  4. Q&A and clarifications

    Suppliers ask questions in the tender Q&A panel. Buyers answer once and publish answers to all registered bidders. GoTenderly timestamps every question and answer and notifies affected suppliers automatically.

  5. Structured submissions

    Suppliers submit using the platform’s structured file layout (Commercial, Technical, Compliance). GoTenderly validates file types, required attachments, and passes initial compliance checks before allowing submission preventing common disqualification causes.

  6. Evaluation workflow

    Buyers create an evaluation panel, assign evaluators, and upload scoring rubrics. Evaluators score independently; GoTenderly calculates weighted scores (technical, commercial, delivery, local content) and highlights pass/fail gates. Redacted commercial bids can be used to preserve impartiality during technical scoring.

  7. Recommendation & award

    After scoring, the system generates a ranked recommendation, audit-ready evaluation report, and an editable award letter. Once approved through the buyer’s internal workflow, the award is published and notifications are sent to winners and unsuccessful bidders with debrief templates available on demand.

  8. Contract management (post-award)

    GoTenderly offers contract templates, milestone tracking, invoice & payment schedules, and performance dashboards. Notices, LD calculations, and warranty tracking are stored with the original tender record.

Key Features (What Makes GoTenderly Different)

  • Guided tender creation: stepwise form that extracts dates and key fields for indexing and alerts.
  • Structured submissions: required folder structure, automated checks, and resume/auto-fill for returning bidders.
  • Integrated Q&A with audit trail: publish once to all bidders and keep a transparent Q&A history.
  • Evaluator workspace: blind scoring, rubric templates, and auto-weighted results with audit-ready export.
  • Notifications & alerts: email, SMS and in-platform, plus calendar sync for key dates.
  • Templates & downloads: price schedules, bidder declarations, contract samples, and BoQ templates included.
  • Security & compliance: role-based access, 2FA, encrypted storage, and document access logs.
  • Reporting & analytics: tender pipelines, supplier activity, bid success rates, and spend analytics.

How Suppliers Use GoTenderly Quick Checklist

A supplier-focused checklist to prepare and submit bids using the platform.

  • Complete company profile, upload trade license and classification documents.
  • Subscribe to relevant tags and set tender alerts for categories you target.
  • Pre-load CVs, templates, and bank references for fast submission.
  • Use the platform’s price schedule template to ensure correct format and currency.
  • Use the Q&A panel for clarifications and check published answers before submitting.
  • Run the platform validation checks (Commercial, Technical, Compliance) fix flagged items before final submission.
  • Download the submission receipt and keep the timestamped audit record for your files.

Integrations & Exports

GoTenderly integrates with common procurement and office tools so teams can work with familiar systems:

  • Calendar (ICS) export for deadlines and events
  • CSV / Excel export for BoQs and evaluation results
  • API access for ERP or finance systems (award & invoice handoff)
  • Email/SMS gateway for supplier notifications

Security, Access & Audit

Security and traceability are built-in: role-based access controls, two-factor authentication, encrypted document storage, and immutable activity logs (publish, edit, question, answer, submission, evaluation). Every action is timestamped and exportable for legal or audit review.

Pricing & Plans (Example)

We offer tiered plans to match organisation size and needs:

  • Starter: 1 procurement user, basic tender publishing, supplier database, essential templates.
  • Business: multi-user workflows, PQ stage, evaluator workspace, reporting exports.
  • Enterprise: API access, SSO, custom SLAs, dedicated onboarding and priority support.

(Contact sales for volume pricing and custom integrations.)

Platform Tips for Faster Results

  • Tag tenders clearly (sector + location) to improve discoverability for qualified suppliers.
  • Attach evaluation rubrics and weightings at publish time to reduce clarifications and speed evaluation.
  • Use redacted commercial bids during technical scoring to keep evaluations impartial.
  • Publish Q&A answers publicly and on time to reduce disputes after award.

Common Questions

  • Can I import old tender documents?

    Yes upload your document and use the guided form to extract key fields and attach original files.

  • How does GoTenderly prevent late submissions?

    All submissions are timestamped. Late uploads are blocked after the configured deadline; administrators can export audit logs showing exact submission times.

  • Is data stored in Qatar?

    GoTenderly supports regional hosting options; for government work, choose the Qatar-hosted tenancy to meet local data rules.

Final Notes

GoTenderly reduces manual work, improves fairness and traceability, and helps both buyers and suppliers move through the tender lifecycle faster and with fewer errors. Use the guided templates, structured submissions, and evaluator tools to tighten your procurement process and create audit-ready outcomes.
